column1: Local Foods////THE SANDWICH. There were probably like 5 separate components that made up this
column2: but they all worked really well. Under the top pretzel bun
column3: they layered some crispy chicken skin
column4: and that was probably the best part of the sandwich. It was such a nice contrast to the juicy
column5: and succulent chicken underneath. After some vegetables
column6: came the chicken. I can't really tell honestly between good chicken and soso chicken
column7: but it was hella moist. Below that came the nut "crumble"
column8: which was almost like a nutty paste smeared onto the bottom bun. Since it got to soak up all those heavenly juices from the chicken
column9: it almost tasted like savory peanut butter. It was a complete package
column10: and everything complimented one another and just worked perfectly. By the way
column11: portion sizes for the sandwich were okay but it filled me up pretty well.
